newsitem.title: UK: Crude helps NWE oil products hold mainly steady.
newsitem.headline: Crude helps NWE oil products hold mainly steady.

text.p: NWE oil products were steady to slightly firmer on Friday as crude held up, traders said.
Gasoline was broadly steady after an early hike up to $212 for eurograde barges. Later the range was closer to $209-211.
Naphtha was very narrowly firmer, by 50 cents or so, with the physical market leading the swaps market.
Gas oil eased as sellers were forced to respond to scant buying interets.
Low sulphur fuel was bid at $97 fob a tonne but no prompt material was available. High sulphur barges drifted down $1 to coast along the bottom at $80/$81.
